SEARCH
Package game

Class Game

java.lang.Object
game.Game
public class Game extends Object
The Game class represents the main logic and flow of a Backgammon game. It includes methods for initializing the game, displaying the game board, handling player turns, executing moves, managing game state, and determining the winner based on game outcomes. It also incorporates a doubling cube for handling double offers during the game.

    • resetGame

      public static void resetGame(Board board, User Winner, User Loser)
      Resets the game state after a match is completed.
      Parameters:
      board - The Board object representing the game board.
      winner - The User object representing the winner of the match.
      loser - The User object representing the loser of the match.

    • FoundWinner

      public static boolean FoundWinner(User player1, User player2)
      Checks if a winner has been found based on the current game state.
      Parameters:
      player1 - The User object representing Player 1.
      player2 - The User object representing Player 2.
      Returns:
      True if a winner is found, false otherwise.

    • determineGameResult

      public static int determineGameResult(Triangle.Checker checker)
      Determines the game result based on the current game state.
      Parameters:
      checker - The Checker type representing the current player.
      Returns:
      The result of the game, indicating a normal win, gammon, or backgammon.
